programme.title: A Lust to Kill
programme.desc: A marshal (Jim Davis) uses an outlaw's (Don Megowan) girlfriend (Allison Hayes) as bait to lure him into a showdown.

programme.title: Law of the Pampas
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) and his sidekick (Russell Hayden) head for South America to deliver cattle.

programme.title: The Gunman From Bodie
programme.desc: The Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) act like strangers to catch a crooked lawyer.

programme.title: Arizona Thunderbolt
programme.desc: A circus performer (Joe Cook) and his piano-playing partner (Robert Cummings) go after a pair of ruthless rustlers.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Matt must restore order to a town controlled by outlaws.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat and Stoney investigate a land title dispute.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Uncle Joe decides to go into the cologne business.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Betty Jo becomes the first female contestant in the horseshoe tournament.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A clever criminal hopes to rob a wealthy rancher, but Cisco and Pancho bring the man to justice.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: An escaped convict is nearly murdered while trying to prove that he did not commit a crime.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Harry Tracy terrorized America's northwest at the end of the 19th century; Matt and a posse have corner the outlaw.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie follow Butch Cassidy to South America.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Judge Bean intervenes when the brothers Hart accuse each other of crimes including cattle rustling; the Judge feels something is wrong and wonders about Mr. Welles's involvement.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Bill Davis is killed and the Judge and Jeff track the killers to the Mexico; they are joined by rancher John Gorman, who is suspiciously eager to instantly hang those responsible.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) becomes involved in a controversy between a teen (Carolyn Craig) and her overly possessive father (Ewing Mitchell).

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) and Lofty (Brad Johnson) try to discover the identity of a masked man known as the Robin Hood Kid (Tyler MacDuff).

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Hawkeye and Chingachgook escort young Greg to the boy's Aunt Emma and Uncle Mort; Greg inherits his parents valuable mine which makes him a target.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Cressing claims to have a royal grant giving him ownership of the town.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A shepherd ignores the Cartwrights' warning not to drive his flock across the Ponderosa; guest Everett Sloane.

programme.title: Crashing Thru
programme.desc: Sgt. Renfrew (James Newill) and Constable Kelly (Warren Hull) are traveling on a cargo freighter when they meet Ann (Jean Carmen), a charming young woman who, unbeknownst to them, is part of a gang that plans to steal the freighter's gold shipment.

programme.title: Shine on Harvest Moon
programme.desc: Former partner Milt Brower (William Farnum) and Pa Jackson (Stanley Andrews) are engaged in an embittered land dispute that turns ugly when Jackson accuses Brower of the dastardly crime of cattle rustling.

programme.title: Code of the Fearless
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger pretends he has been discharged from service to trick outlaws into accepting him into their gang.

programme.title: Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The frontiersman (George O'Brien) leads settlers to Kentucky, where a white renegade (John Carradine) unites tribes against them.

programme.title: Under California Stars
programme.desc: Returning to his California ranch for some rest and relaxation, cowboy movie star Roy Rogers (Roy Rogers) finds himself drawn into battle with a dastardly group of horse rustlers.

programme.title: The Trail Beyond
programme.desc: Rod Drew (John Wayne) is asked to search for missing people in Canada, and quickly finds out a gang of French Canadian outlaws have been kidnapping people.

programme.title: Santa Fe Trail
programme.desc: Jeb Stuart and George Custer get stationed at Fort Leavenworth in Kansas and work together to stop abolitionist John Brown.

programme.title: Come on Cowboys
programme.desc: The Three Mesquiteers (Robert Livingston, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune) save a circus friend from a bum rap.

programme.title: Ghost Town Gold
programme.desc: The Three Mesquiteers set out to trap outlaws who have robbed a bank and stashed the loot in an abandoned village.

programme.title: Phantom Ranger
programme.desc: A federal investigator (Tim McCoy) poses as an outlaw to catch a gang of counterfeiters which has kidnapped a government engraver.

programme.title: Brand of the Devil
programme.desc: Tex Wyatt (Dave "Tex" O'Brien), Jim Steel (Jim Newill) and Panhandle Perkins (Guy Wilkerson) are Texas Rangers working undercover to bust up a cattle rustling ring that leaves cards bearing a devilish pitchfork to announce its presence.
